revised_title: Criticality in Nearly Circular Cylinders: Thermal Stability and Surface Cooling
tldr: This article examines the critical conditions in a nearly circular cylinder with a zero-order chemical reaction and Frank-Kamenetskii approximation. The authors determine the critical value of the Frank-Kamenetskii parameter and the corresponding steady temperature distribution for uniform surface temperature and Newtonian cooling. They find that the nearly circular cylinder is less stable than a regular shape with the same mean radius.
